channels.description: Holds the relative paths to the individual channel and their operations. Channel paths are relative to servers.

correlationId.description: An object that specifies an identifier at design time that can used for message tracing and correlation.

description.description: A optional description of the correlation ID. GitHub Flavored Markdown is allowed.

location.description: A runtime expression that specifies the location of the correlation ID

url.description: The URL for the target documentation. This MUST be in the form of an absolute URL.

messages.description: JSON objects describing the messages being consumed and produced by the API.

oauth2Flow.description: Configuration details for a supported OAuth Flow

authorizationUrl.description: The authorization URL to be used for this flow. This MUST be in the form of an absolute URL.

refreshUrl.description: The URL to be used for obtaining refresh tokens. This MUST be in the form of an absolute URL.

scopes.description: The available scopes for the OAuth2 security scheme. A map between the scope name and a short description for it.

tokenUrl.description: The token URL to be used for this flow. This MUST be in the form of an absolute URL.

oauth2Flows.description: Allows configuration of the supported OAuth Flows.

description.description: A short description for security scheme.

authorizationCode.description: Configuration for the OAuth Authorization Code flow.

clientCredentials.description: Configuration for the OAuth Client Credentials flow.

implicit.description: Configuration for the OAuth Implicit flow.

password.description: Configuration for the OAuth Resource Owner Protected Credentials flow.

type.description: A short description for security scheme.

operation.description: Describes a publish or a subscribe operation. This provides a place to document how and why messages are sent and received.

description.description: A verbose explanation of the operation.

security.description: A declaration of which security mechanisms are associated with this operation.

summary.description: A short summary of what the operation is about.

tags.description: A list of tags for logical grouping and categorization of operations.

traits.description: A list of traits to apply to the operation object.

operationTrait.description: Describes a trait that MAY be applied to an Operation Object.

description.description: A verbose explanation of the operation.

operationId.description: Unique string used to identify the operation. The id MUST be unique among all operations described in the API.

security.description: A declaration of which security mechanisms are associated with this operation.

summary.description: A short summary of what the operation is about.

tags.description: A list of tags for logical grouping and categorization of operations.

parameter.description: Describes a parameter included in a channel name.

description.description: A brief description of the parameter. This could contain examples of use. GitHub Flavored Markdown is allowed.

location.description: A runtime expression that specifies the location of the parameter value

parameters.description: JSON objects describing reusable channel parameters.

deprecated.description: Specifies that a schema is deprecated and SHOULD be transitioned out of usage

discriminator.description: Adds support for polymorphism. The discriminator is the schema property name that is used to differentiate between other schema that inherit this schema.

externalDocs.description: Additional external documentation for this schema.

schema.description: The Schema Object allows the definition of input and output data types. These types can be objects, but also primitives and arrays.

schemas.description: JSON objects describing schemas the API uses.

server.description: An object representing a message broker, a server or any other kind of computer program capable of sending and/or receiving data

bindings.description: A map where the keys describe the name of the protocol and the values describe protocol-specific definitions for the server.

description.description: An optional string describing the host designated by the URL. CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text representation.

protocol.description: The protocol this URL supports for connection. Supported protocol include, but are not limited to: amqp, amqps, http, https, ibmmq, jms, kafka, kafka-secure, anypointmq, mqtt, secure-mqtt, solace, stomp, stomps, ws, wss, mercure, googlepubsub.

protocolVersion.description: The version of the protocol used for connection. For instance: AMQP 0.9.1, HTTP 2.0, Kafka 1.0.0, etc.

security.description: A declaration of which security mechanisms can be used with this server. The list of values includes alternative security requirement objects that can be used.

tags.description: A list of tags for logical grouping and categorization of servers.

url.description: A URL to the target host. This URL supports Server Variables and MAY be relative, to indicate that the host location is relative to the location where the AsyncAPI document is being served.

variables.description: A map between a variable name and its value. The value is used for substitution in the server's URL template.

serverVariable.description: An object representing a Server Variable for server URL template substitution.

default.description: The default value to use for substitution, and to send, if an alternate value is not supplied.

description.description: An optional description for the server variable.

enum.description: An enumeration of string values to be used if the substitution options are from a limited set.

examples.description: An array of examples of the server variable.

serverVariables.description: A map between a variable name and its value. The value is used for substitution in the server's URL template.

servers.description: The Servers Object is a map of Server Objects.
